the person who has to learn the most is a catcher there are signs from the dugout signs on offense pitchers have different signs but the thing about pudge is that he's faced a lot of these guys

he got here early went to lunch came back and wanted to watch a lot of film he talked to tony pena i think in a sense from a logistics standpoint the player that has to learn the most is a catcher because you got signs from the bench when you're on defense you got signs when you're on offense every pitcher has different signs so it's a lot to go through
he actually started slow and gave a lot of pitches in the first but he got dialed in
has a chance to be a plus pitch if he can command it more consistantly
i'm just looking for the actions in his pitches how he competes and mound presence
when you're a young pitcher you say who does he remind me of i can tell you he looks like he's a got a pretty good feel of what he's doing he's pretty sound and his stuff really looks very good
he's hitting home runs stealing bases driving in important runs and making great catches he's doing everything
